channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Co-Term Information Session - February 26
item.description: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - RPI students considering the NEW online, part-time Co-Term are invited to join us for pizza and this information session in the Student Union to learn about the Institute’s available programs. Expect to hear details about the project-based model, learning through iteration, and how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise in a targeted and experiential learning environment. Let us know to we can expect you by registering.
item.author: Students

item.title: NYS DOT Tabling to be held on February 24
item.description: On Monday, February 24th, the NYS Department of Transportation (a CCPD sponsor) will be tabling in the Union between 10:30 AM-3:00 PM. Stop by their table to learn more about full-time careers, internships, and more! Learn More on Handshake!
item.author: Students

item.title: Annual 2025 McKinney Student Awards Ceremony and Speaker Series to be held April 9
item.description: The 83rd annual McKinney Reading Series and Student Awards Ceremony is Wednesday, April 9th, 7:00-9:00 p.m. featuring Lan Samantha Chang, winner of the Anisfield-Wolf Book Award for Fiction and the PEN Open Book Award. The event will feature the announcement of McKinney Student Writing Contest winners, a fiction reading, and audience Q & A. An opportunity to purchase books and meet the author will follow.

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Information Session Slated for Feburary 21
item.description: Friday, February 21, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., will be reviewing the online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates. Expect to hear details about how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment. Please RSVP if you plan to attend and learn more about Rensselaer at Work.

item.title: Western Digital - HDD Teardown workshop to be held Feb. 27 between 4-5PM
item.description: On Thurs., Feb. 27th from 4-5pm, Western Digital will be hosting their HDD Teardown workshop. This workshop gives attendees the opportunity to learn about the cloud through a hands-on workshop related to data storage. Learn more and register in Handshake—space is limited! By registering, you are committing to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: Celebrate the Achievements of Rensselaer Students
item.description: Nominate a deserving graduating student to recognize their exceptional contributions to the Rensselaer community through academic, athletic, and service endeavors. Their dedication has strengthened our community, and these awards provide a meaningful way to express our gratitude for their lasting impact. We welcome both self-nominations and referral applications. The nomination deadline is Friday, March 21, 2025, at 11:59 p.m., EDT.
item.author: Community

item.title: Staying Healthy This Spring Semester
item.description: With winter virus season upon us, it’s important that we all take steps to protect our health and minimize the spread of illness on campus. Influenza has been peaking since January, both in New York State and on our campus. Simple preventive measures can make a big difference in keeping our community safe and well. Learn more about how to keep yourself and others healthy!

item.title: Fidelity Confidential Consultation (By Phone with Zoom Video Option) - February 24
item.description: Monday, February 24, 2025 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM - Schedule a confidential consultation to help you become better informed and more confident about your workplace retirement savings plan benefits. To schedule an appointment, call 1-800-642-7131, Monday through Friday, 8:00 am to midnight, or online.

item.title: UPWARDS Lightning Talks to be held February 26
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join us for the next UPWARDS Lightning Talks on Advanced Methods for Measurement in Semiconductor Systems, hosted by Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute via WebEx. The lighting talks will be 5 minutes each, with time for Q&A. The list of speakers will be announced ahead of the session. For any questions, please contact Sarah Niemann, RPI Assistant Vice President for Research, at niemas2@rpi.edu.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
